prerequisites.title: An Eye in the Warp
prerequisites.description: Characters with the Psyker or Untouchable elite advance cannot gain the Navigator elite advance.

prerequisites.title: Genetic Heritage
prerequisites.description: Navigator Elite Advance may only be taken during Character creation

information.title: The Boons of Lineage
information.description: A Navigator hails from a lineage of a particular type that grants her a number of advantages and quirks. The Lineages which a Navigator may hail from are Nomadic Houses, Magisterial Houses, Shrouded Houses, or Renegade Houses. The details and effects of each of these lineages may be found at Navigator Houses.

information.title: Navigator Mutations
information.description: The Navigator begins play with a number of Navigator Mutations determined by the nature of her Lineage. Thereafter whenever the character gains a new Navigator power, or increases her level of mastery over a power she already has, she must test for mutation, an Ordinary (+10) Toughness Test. If she fails this test, then a flaw in her genes has revealed itself, and she must generate a mutation from Navigator Mutations.

information.title: Unlicensed
information.description: If the character does not have the Navis Nobilte background, they also gain the Enemy (Navis Nobilite) talent

information.title: The Eye is Open
information.description: A Navigator is a living window into the warp, a fact mercifully mitigated for her own soul's and sanity's sake by the effects of the Navigator Gene that allows her to perceive the warp's mind-blasting truth in a unique way that allows her human mind to deal with it. As a result she does not suffer Corruption Points from Warp Shock, although she can acquire Corruption Points normally by other means.
